item.source: Another mod I will be in

item.title: Another mod I will be in
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
jinzo_ningen01:

If you don’t like mods that reintroduce old content from the goldsource Half-Life games, why are you on the Black Mesa forum?

The remake is something else entirely. The point of black mesa is to recreate Half-Life in it’s entirety, and that is a solid foundation for a mod. But when you have a mod with no idea what to expect in terms of gameplay, and rides on little more then pretty graphics, weapons and monsters, then the mod is guaranteed to either fail or be horribly bland.

Lolipopman:

Hmm… Xen isnt their homeworld. Its just a borderworld.

Where did I ever say it was?

mini_bunney:

Well that’s just stupid… It’s not like this is some random mod, mashed together from old HL1 enemies, Combine and Alyx, that doesn’t really follow any story at all. This is an attempt to re-create HL1 with nice new graphics!

You’re not talking about the same mod as the rest of us.

@Sitten_duck: Thank’s for helping make some sense of it. I assumed the game was set much closer to the events of HL2.

Read full topic

item.title: Another mod I will be in
item.dc:creator: iKy
item.description:
JeffMOD:

But why would they NOT want quality? I say take her best lines, and maybe use that as leverage to improve the other voice actors. It’s lot like people like listening to monotone, bland, poorly written lines, so why settle for it?
They should let her work to the top of her ability.

i already exampled paranoid park as a movie where they did not want exceptional interpretation because it was supposed to be a character who doesn’t really show emotion ,

like they say

"a voice acting is about as good as the place where it’s used "

maybe our catz is too expressive to intense for what they need , if they want to modified to a drone woman or a scared in shock woman a too expressive voice would be out of place no? , this assuming they are not idiots

it’s safe to assume that they make best use of what they chose , after all , they wouldn’t start a mod without knowing about what it will be about no?

item.source: Another mod I will be in

item.title: Another mod I will be in
item.dc:creator: Sitten_duck
item.description:
Dias:

Unoriginality: Wanting new monsters in a game, so instead of creating new ones, digging up old ones from the previous games.

Plot:Still looking forward to seeing how they try to justify their existance. Or more likely just not question it at all.

Reintroducing old content from the goldsource Half-Life games is the most common and shameless attempt at generating a fanbase next to basically any generic thing you’d see in the same sentence as “realism.” Because that’s the two things that seem to draw idiots like flies in the mod community. Realism and Nostalgia.

Many fans like to expand upon a story. Just look at all the fan fiction that’s been created for Star Trek, Star Wars, etc… They like to fill in areas of the story that aren’t covered in the main plot. It’s just a fan’s prerogative to do so if they want to. It doesn’t appeal to everyone, but it doesn’t have to.

Remember, these are “Sort Stories” the one about, " [Becoming] part of a small Civil Protection team that is pitted against the remains of the Xenian forces, who are making a last ditch effort to escape Earth. Utilize a variety of new tools such as controllable manhacks, as well as using new vehicles such as the APC."

If they want to fill in an unanswered question in Half-Life about what happen to the remnants of Nihilianth’s forces now trapped on Earth, then it would make sense to use creatures from Nihilanth’s forces.

Now they are creating Manta’s to fight ground forces, and Agrunts, alien controllers, and Vortigaunts recently freed from there collars and armor trying tp survive in a new environment and possibly find their way back home. That’s different.

If totally new creatures are required to be original, then OP4 should be completely original since he had different weapons, different HUD, raceX, and so on. While Black Mesa’s attempt at Nostalgia and realism is common, generic, and shameless. Metastasis would also be unoriginal since there is essentially nothing new.

I am not trying to flame you, or pick a fight, and I really hope that it doesn’t come across as such. But Fans wanting to experience nostalgia and continue to retell and expand on a story that they love is not shameless. It’s only shameless when someone is trying to make money off of it, and money is their only goal.

Read full topic

I know what Black Mesa is. It just seemed pretty ironic that he would complain about THAT in particular, since that’s exactly what Black Mesa is. Old content brought to new engine.

item.source: Another mod I will be in

item.title: Another mod I will be in
item.dc:creator: jinzo_ningen01
item.description:
Dias:

Plot:Still looking forward to seeing how they try to justify their existance. Or more likely just not question it at all.

So from that incredibly vague quote, I gathered that they could have been stranded on Earth (Not their natural native environment), gained “access to a steady food supply” (again, left ambiguous), and as far as we know, could be thriving on Earth during HL2. It’s not like they’ll have to jump through hoops to explain that.

That quote is so full of if’s, probably’s, whatever’s, and may-well-have’s that it literally says nothing about what happened to the Controllers.

Reintroducing old content from the goldsource Half-Life games is the most common and shameless attempt at generating a fanbase next to basically any generic thing you’d see in the same sentence as “realism.” Because that’s the two things that seem to draw idiots like flies in the mod community. Realism and Nostalgia.

If you don’t like mods that reintroduce old content from the goldsource Half-Life games, why are you on the Black Mesa forum?

Read full topic
